授業目的: The course will give students the opportunity to learn about a field of research, industrial relations, which is not very prominent in Japan, in order to make them aware of the importance of IR in particular in foreign countries. Therefore, the course will provide students with an in-depth introduction into the research area of industrial and work relations. Its intention is to make students familiar with various types of industrial relation traditions and systems and make them aware of the importance of IR for successful company management.
到達目標: Students are supposed to acquire a broad knowledge about different types of organization of IR, forms of bargaining and various regulation with regard to IR in selected countries. The goal is to make students realize that IR in Europe in particular, but also in the USA and increasingly in developing countries IR too are a decisive factor for company success or failure.
関連科目: All management and economy related courses of the EUIJ certificate program (enrollment in the program required to attend courses at Kobe and Osaka Universities)
授業方法: The course follows a seminar rather than a lecture style approach.

第1回: Introduction: Why do Industrial Relations Matter
第13回: European work councils: A success story?
